newsitem.title: USA: Erawest in New Zealand long distance pact.
newsitem.headline: Erawest in New Zealand long distance pact.

text.p: Erawest Inc and its subsidiary Dynamic Bell said Monday that they had signed a pact with Telecom New Zealand Ltd to provide long distance service in New Zealand.
Erawest said in a statement the pact could increase revenues by an additional $100 million and earnings by $10 million in fiscal 1998.
It said Dynamic Bell is one of the leading telecommunications companies in Australia.
Erawest shares were off 3/8 early Monday afternoon at 9.
Erawest Chairman Nick Flower said in an interview that the pact could add earnings of between $1 to $2 a share for Erawest in 1998.
He declined to give details on the pact, except to say that a part of it involves buying long distance rates at a lower price and reselling them.
